summary: The Disaster Recovery Efficiency Act (H.R. 732) mandates the Administrator of the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) and the Secretary of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) to implement specific recommendations made by the Comptroller General of the United States. These recommendations, detailed in a November 15, 2022 report titled "Disaster Recovery: Actions Needed to Improve the Federal Approach," aim to improve federal disaster recovery efforts. The bill was introduced on January 24, 2025, and referred to the Committees on Transportation and Infrastructure, and Financial Services.
